channel.title: aws on MBlog
channel.description: Recent content in aws on MBlog

item.title: How to Get the OS of a Running EC2 Instance
item.description: Go to the EC2 console and the select the instance what you want to check. Then go to Action -> Instance setting -> Get instance screenshot In the screenshot you can find the current version of OS.

item.title: Connect Redis on EC2 Instance
item.description: Installl Redis CLI on EC2 sudo apt-get install redis Connect to Redis redis-cli -h cache-001.xxxxxx.0001.euc1.cache.amazonaws.com -c -p 6379

item.title: CloudFront 403 Error
item.description: After call URL http://dev.admin.skimpel.de/ I got the 403 error from AWS CloudFront. After add dev.admin.skimpel.de to alternate domain name section the problem was solved.

item.title: Validate Aws Certificate on United Domain
Upload Files to Aws S3
item.description: Upload single file to S3 bucket 1aws s3 cp sample2.txt s3://test-s3-bucket/data/ Upload all files from a folder to S3 bucket recursively 1aws s3 cp tmp/ s3://test-s3-bucket/data/tmp/ --recursive Using Sync Sync is a command used to synchronize source and target directories. Sync is by default recursive which means all the files and subdirectories in the source will be copied to target recursively. Use the below command to Sync your local directory to your S3 bucket.

item.title: AWS Cloud Front - access denied to S3 bucket
item.description: Original explanation hier After creating cloud front distribution with mapping to my S3 bucket I got this access error: The reason was wrong auto coplete value in this section: What you should to to it’s go to the S3 bucket and grab the URL in the property tab on the down of the tab and put it in the origin domain input of the cloud front. Enjoy!
